title: One Week Out, Senate Control Hinges On Handful Of Tight Races
teaser: The balance of power depends on races in Colorado, Iowa, Georgia, Kansas and North Carolina.
contentencoded:
With one week to go until Election Day, the question of which party will take control of the Senate is still very much a tossup.

The latest polls indicate Republicans have the momentum, but the balance of power hinges on a handful of very tight, key races: Colorado, Iowa, Georgia, Kansas and North Carolina.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson talks to Mark Murray, senior political editor for NBC News, about what’s happening in these races that are likely to tip the balance.

Guest

  • Mark Murray, senior political editor for NBC News. He tweets @mmurraypolitics.
